title: Nature's marvel
review: Beautiful place to visit at Lansdowne. Little difficult approach to the monument. It is better to take jeep on rent than to walk 3 kms.

title: Hyped place
review: There is nothing to veiw here.

title: Tracking lovers special
review: Bhim Pakora is basically two rocks balanced nicely so that it never falls and just viberate.

title: Interesting place.
review: Two Huge rocks are lying on each other. One can shake the upper rock with his fingers but  can't move it. This was very interesting. This place is located on the way to Jungle Resort (1 km before the resort)

title: OhkaY
review: Two Huge rocks lying on each other. You can shake the Above rock but You cannot move it. This was interesting.

title: To me, overhyped
review: It’s a long walk from Gandhi market city centre. Everyone you ask leads you towards it but none reveal the fact that it’s about two kilometers. Two kms wasn’t an issue but the path wasn’t great. Personal vehicles can only go a certain distance and you will need to stop atleast 1.5 kms short. Then the walk takes you through a kutcha path which also passes through the garbage dumping ground of Lansdowne. Will suggest, take a Taxi/jeep from the city centre for a return trip. The walk is not worth it. At Bhim pakora I was able to move the rock but then felt is overhyped considering the overall experience including the walk

title: must stay
review: its a cool weather when i visit and awesome location. Looking once again in august to stay. nice staff and hospitality is nearby.

title: Nice stone called him pakora
review: Nice peaceful beautiful Nature... him Paloma is a nice place .. a stone vibrate. When we touch it.. so awesome but road was so risky for drive but you can go by walk 2 km. From market

title: Interesting name
review: All curiosity faded after locating it..

title: Interesting and quaint
review: The churches are imposing and beautifully lit up at night but often closed ...Walk around it is clean and well maintained by the army and you will clean out your lungs!

title: Waste of time
review: Nothing exciting about this place. Just a few rocks on top of each other. Something that is seen everywhere on mountains.

title: Ok place
review: Nothing great about this location and can be avoided. I didnt find anything very special. Just a rock formation and much better can be seen around lansdowne.

title: Nothing Point
review: There nothing special at this point, and its complete time consuming. Roads were dusty and area also prone to wild animals.

title: Bhim Pakora - AVOID VISITING.
review: About 3 km down the main bazaar. Rough road. Had to abandon the car and walked the last 300 meters or so. To b honest have seen much more spectacular rock formations as compared to Bhim Pakora. This is nothing to speak about. We actually felt cheated.

title: A Waste of Time.
review: The road leading to the place is a narrow dirt road which seemed quite risky. The four rocks piled on one another were definitely not worth the risk specially when the whole area is dotted with big rocks

title: Just a rock formation
review: Lansdowne itself is very small and these points are close by.

title: The most amazing place in Lansdowne!
review: Can you believe that the two rocks are stacked in a way that they maintain an amazingly superb balance. They can be moved by a very light push but will not fall no matter how hard you try! Worth giving a visit. The road goes from Gandhi chowk.

title: Intresting point
review: this place is not as such a great location but it is interesting as two rocks are place aside each other precisely balance against each other, you will feel you can move it with touch also but is does not move you can try as much as you like

title: Nothing great
review: Bhim pakora is listed as an attraction in Lansdowne, but it's all hype with no substance. First it's quite difficult to reach there as a 1 km pakka followed by a 1 km kachcha road lead to it and the point is so non discript that you will fail to locate it unless there happens to be a rare local passerby to point it out for you. However if you are a nature enthusiast and trekking in the forests is your forte then you'll enjoy the path, not the destination, which was the case with me.

title: Nothing is there
review: If you are in lansdowne and want to do a small track then you can come to bhim pakora, You can enjoy the path you will travel but specifically Bhim Pakora has nothing to offer.

title: walk
review: although this place is not as famous as tip in top and bhulla lake but still beautiful.

title: Not So Worth
review: I went by car but would advice you to go tracking to this place if you have leisure time in Lansdowne. But ya the rocks move slightly even at finger pressure. A resort is there ahead of this which is solitary and cool.

title: Risky place, Not worth visit
review: Please avoid going to this place.. The road towards it very risky and it is not even worth it

title: A surprise landmark at the end of a dangerous drive
review: I had read about this place before going to lansdowne and was eager to visit this place. What i didn't realize was that the road to it would be so poor. There are no hoardings guiding you to this lovely place. So we relied on the age old method of asking for directions. Some 1-2 kms from the main bazaar, there is a narrow slip road which looks like an off-beaten path leading to this landmark. Take the drive at your own risk (preferably in a 4 X 4 vehicle) since it can get really slippery during rains.  The place like most of the lansdowne is quiet and serene. Its basically three rocks on top of each other and looks like one giant burger.

title: lansdowne
review: this place is as nice as the other famous places in landowne but it is not that famous.

title: interesting
review: the attraction is interesting especially because of the story attached to it. however, the road down to it is narrow, rough and pretty deserted. it was a bone rattling drive to and from the attraction.

title: Much hyped stack of boulders
review: If you go by the legend, that the boulders were stacked by Bhim and it does not fall, it may seem interesting.But otherwise, I didnt find it so interesting.

title: Bhim pakora
review: Bhim pakora  is one of the tourist attraction in lansdowne. Bhim pakora is a 3 big stone layer one over the other and to reach there you have to go through rough road it is very high risk if u will driving over there. I suggest you go there by walking.

title: scinic beaty
review: ideal to spent time in the late evening before the sun sets. it gives us a gr8 panoramic view of the foothills

title: Amazing
review: Legend says Bhim placed the rocks in such a way that however much you push, the rocks will not tumble. Difficult to reach as there is only a narrow dirt track to the place. Amazing if true.

title: Misleading Attraction
review: The approach to the place is pathetic,adventurous for SUV and threatening for other cars.No Direction Board anywhere,Even after reaching we have to ascertain about it as no Display Board if its such a Historical place then totally disappointment .Even after pushing by both hands it was'nt shaking .May be the people who could shake it with one finger be descendent of Bhima.

title: Intresting place
review: You need to walk around 2 or more Km to be at this place. The intresting point about this place is that the stone can be moved with finger but they will not fall.

title: Please skip this
review: Quick Facts:

title: Bheem Pakora
review: this is exactly a resort 2.5 km away through a rough and arduous track. At about two km there is a big stone which can be moved with little effort.

title: An unusual sight
review: It is not uncommon to find select unique rock formations in hill stations (e.g., camel back rock on camel back road in Mussoorie).. this is too like so many others...

title: Checklist stuff !
review: Nothing very great about it , but lansdown has not much to offer , so one can visit this and click some selfies. :)

title: Nothing great
review: It's a combination of three super heavy rocks perched precariously on to each other. The only fun is if you rock the top most rock, it trembles as if it is going to tumble over. But, the 2 kms road is not tarred, rather full of rocks and do narrow that only one vehicle can pass at a time.

title: Worst experience
review: I suggest not to go and waste your time because you have to walk 3 km (approx) from the main market of Lansdowne to reach there and when you will reach there, your reaction would be "What the hell is this". But yes if you have enough time and want to roam, then you can go and enjoy the walk. Thank You.

title: a good place yet nothing special here.
review: A mountain with an odd shape. Well, it is definitely maintained well but nothing interesting here. You can just go and see the oddly shaped hill :)

title: Bhim Pakora, 06 Jun'16
review: On a family trip to Lansdowne, we were wondering what this sign

title: Don't drive to this place
review: This place is good if you want to walk down the road and watch it. It is much hyped!!!!

title: For Nature Lover
review: Its a hanging stone in the deep forest, if you push the stone by one finger its shows like hanging. but if you push it by full force, it will stay same.

title: A surprise weather change enroute Bhim Pakora- Loved the walk :)
review: We took walking through the by-lanes of Lansdowne and it was magical. The weather was outstandingly pleasant and so was the place.

title: Difficult to reach
review: Quite away from the main road. Not good connectivity. On the private road of some resort. Road are  dangerous for vehicles and also dirty.

title: avoid going to this place
review: its just a time waste, if you want to get your car ripped off then your are most welcome to the world of bhim pakoda. this place suck and a big time waste.

title: Adventurous Bhim Pakora
review: Recommended by local people to visit there, we tried the reach the place. After driving through tough market place, narrow lanes, we finally reach a Kacha road, not motarable easily, had tough time to reverse the can, finally abandoned the visit. Bad approach road. You can go there if you are keen to walk for about 3 km on tough path.

title: Average place to see.
review: This place is average. One rock balancing on top of the other stone which is co-incident. Drive till this place is terrible, all rocky bad road. Difficult drive your own car.

title: Shaking stone
review: You can shake the top most stone by your hand please do not drive your vehicle while coming there its very difficult.

title: Adventurus sightseeing point
review: Firstly the distance from main gandhi chowk market of lansdowne to

title: laugh out loud
review: cute place a stone that moves with thumb force but not on pushing by hands. i like it as it is anice time pass tourist attraction but way to that place is quite dangerous.

title: Nothing Special
review: It was on the way to our Hotel (Shantiraj Hill View). You have to decend around 2 kms from the Main Market to reach this place - the road is not good. Actually it is a big horizontal rock which is resting over a smaller sized vertical rock and due to the positioning you will feel that you are moving the big horizontal rock when you push it.

title: Just one of those man-made place
review: This place isn;t anything to talk about. It is a long walk from the Market. You keep thinking that you are going to visit a great historical rock which may date back to the age of Mahabharata. Be prepared for dismay. the rock is just placed another one and it does not shake with a thumb. You have to actually put pressure on the rock to see it moving.

title: Bhim Pakora
review: We were not very much impressed when we reached three. There were three big stones placed one over the other. You may have come across such sight many times.These stones are balanced in such a way that even by pushing the top one, it will not come down.

title: Good journey but destination is average
review: It's just a stone on top of another stone, with few stories surrounding it.

title: Don't read reviews!..just go to this place..you wont be disappointed
review: a lot of people don't venture to Bhim Pakora..its hardly 2 kms from the main market..its sort of an abandoned road - which makes it all the more interesting..frankly, its nothing but a rock on top of another rock!..but glad we took the effort to go to it..climb on top of the rock and its a great view..the least important thing to do at lansdowne, but adventurous none the less..

title: Not worth to visit
review: I heared a lot from so many people about bhim pakora and when I was finally in Lansdowne with my friends, I almost forced them to visit this place as they were not in mood to spend there so called valuable time here. We went there and believe me I couldn't find any view or any interesting thing which can save me from the anger of my friends.

title: Bhim's 'shaking' Pakora
review: Bhim Pakora is a big rock piece precariously placed over another big rock and is naturally balanced over it. It moves slightly but noticeably, when pushed but it does not fall down. The way to it passes through the local market and from near a Lansdowne suburb.After crossing the market, the road downhill is in a very bad shape and is very narrow too. This road further goes to the Jungle Resort and perhaps to popularize the spot they have labelled the rock with paint as Bhim Pakora. Nothing very great about it.

title: one time visit..
review: It has a big  stone that can be moved with a single finger by pushing at a marked point and amazingly it doesnt fall....one can visit this place if time permits else can be avoided..

title: A rock that shakes bt not falls
review: Firstly, go there if you can walk upsides too ;)

title: Can be avoided
review: The road till May 2014 is NOT suitable for driving. It is on the way to  Jungle resort.  Two pieces of big stones, one above the other. Need to climg the rocks to feel them moving.

title: Move with Thumb??
review: Some say you can move this rock with your thumb. I could not. Do not go with too much expectations and you wont be disappointing
